image.altText: People walking in Brisbane's Queen Street Mall

props.synopsis: As Australia's economy grows at its slowest pace since the 1990s recession, consumers place more "focus on affordability".

title.children: Australian's economy just recorded its weakest growth in years as households cut back on spending

props.synopsis: The federal government has hosed down the calls from within its own ranks, as new data shows almost two-thirds of Australians delayed treatment due to cost.

title.children: 'I can look into a child's mouth and tell their parents' income': Labor backbench pushes for dental in Medicare

image.altText: A mid shot of Senator Linda Reynolds walking towards the camera outside court, dressed in black with spectacles and a bag.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins and her husband's true colours are on display in a series of text messages that mocked Senator Linda Reynolds after she was hospitalised with heart concerns, a WA court hears.

title.children: Linda Reynolds labelled 'awful human' in text messages between Brittany Higgins and husband

image.altText: Firefighters battling urban bushfire

props.synopsis: As chaotic weather wreaks havoc across Tasmania and Victoria, there are warnings over a heightened threat of bushfires in the coming months in other parts of the country.

title.children: Warnings over increased bushfire risk as Australia records warmest August on record

image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading hospitality groups, Merivale, has been accused of fostering a culture that places women at risk, condones drug use by staff and patrons and fails to adequately address claims of sexual assault.

title.children: Female patrons claim they were introduced as sex workers to VIP guests at Merivale's Ivy nightclub

image.altText: A road can be see through the windscreen of a military vehicle

props.synopsis: For the first time in more than five years and since the Ukraine war began, the ABC crosses into Russia to see what life is like in the occupied city of Sudzha.

title.children: After Ukraine's incursion into Russia, we get a glimpse of life behind Vladimir Putin's iron curtain

image.altText: The words ‘No Change To WA GST’ have been scrawled on a reporter's arm and signed by Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The GST deal has been described as "the worst public policy decision in Australia so far this century" but none of the major parties will touch it for fear of upsetting Western Australia.

title.children: The major parties are stuck in a $53b GST trap — because no-one dares anger the Vengeful Deity of the West

image.altText: A woman in black suit walking out of court.

props.synopsis: Linda Sun, a former aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochulis, is charged with acting as an agent of the Chinese government in exchange for millions of dollars in compensation and gifts.

title.children: Ex-aide of New York governor charged over secretly acting as Chinese agent

image.altText: A family stand on a suburban street next to a bus stop pole.

props.synopsis: Advocates and refugee legal services say there's currently only one option for Palestinians who arrived in Australia on visitor visas since October: to embark on the often years-long process of seeking permanent asylum.

title.children: Darwish never planned on coming to Australia, but he has no choice but to apply to stay here permanently

image.altText: Three men wearing suits stand side by side, holding hands in the middle

props.synopsis: Britain has announced it will immediately suspend 30 of its 350 arms export licences with Israel because of a "clear risk" that such equipment might be used to commit serious violations of international humanitarian law.

title.children: Netanyahu calls UK decision to suspend some arms for Israel 'shameful'. Here's what we know about the suspensions

image.altText: Alana Forster competing at Paris Paralympics.

props.synopsis: Emily Petricola is aiming to win her second gold medal of the Paris Paralympics, while Australian teammate Alana Forster grabs a podium finish in the para cycling road program. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie para cyclists win medals on the road in Paris

image.altText: Regis McPhillamy signage

props.synopsis: The opposition asks Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek to reveal her reasons for granting an Aboriginal protection order over a site earmarked for a tailings dam at the McPhillamys Gold Mine development near Blayney in NSW.

title.children: Coalition challenges Plibersek to explain decision stalling development of $1 billion gold mine

image.altText: Police tape over street

props.synopsis: Police have received more than 20 reports of coercive control since the new laws came into effect at the start of July, tackling abusive and manipulate behaviours against victim-survivors.

title.children: Man charged under new coercive control laws in NSW first

image.altText: An older man with white hair and beard with a video camera near his face.

props.synopsis: After the lifting of a lengthy suppression order, it can now be reported that Geoff Clark has been found guilty of 25 charges relating to about $1 million illegally obtained from his community's Aboriginal trust.

title.children: Former ATSIC head found guilty of defrauding his community of $1 million

image.altText: a woman with a coffee puts her credit card into an eftpos machine

props.synopsis: With the pandemic accelerating the use of cards instead of cash — only 13 per cent of Australians use cash, dropping from 27 per cent in the past five years — these extra charges have become mainstream.

title.children: Credit card surcharges are added to most purchases, but what are the rules behind these extra fees?

image.altText: Palm trees throughout a valley of stepped rice paddies

props.synopsis: Bali boasts world-famous beach clubs, surf breaks and ancient Hindu temples. The only problem is, you often have to battle traffic to get to them.

title.children: Eat, pray, traffic jam: Bali's heaving roads may become a thing of the past with a $29 billion train line

image.altText: Illawarra Mercury

props.synopsis: Australian Community Media will cut 35 editorial positions from across its business after it ceased printing several newspapers due to declining advertising revenue.

title.children: Communities the 'real losers' as ACM cuts dozens of journalist jobs

image.altText: Two young women speak to the media at a water park.

props.synopsis: An island in the heart of Penrith Whitewater Stadium in Sydney's west will be named 'Fox Island' after Olympian sisters, Jess and Noemie Fox.

title.children: Olympic gold medal-winning Fox sisters to have island named after them

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit speaks to the media outside a building.

props.synopsis: The Opposition leader said nobody told him about the federal executive's motion to install an administrative committee to oversee operations in NSW, in the wake of the council nominations fiasco.

title.children: Speakman vows to fight on despite being left in the dark over federal takeover

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: A witness has told the South Australian Supreme Court that Steven Hainsworth tried to sell her items from an alleged victim's home, and allegedly made an admission to killing a man. Warning: This story contains graphic details.

title.children: Alleged serial killer stole and sold victim's belongings, court hears

image.altText: Sheep in a pen on Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: Millions of sterile male blowflies will be bred at a world-first facility and released to mate with females in a trial aiming to end flystrike on the island.

title.children: Hopes painful pest costing sheep farmers millions could soon be eradicated on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: An artists impression of a large city square. In the top right corner, two square photos of two men looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A $42 million sale to pave the way for the redevelopment of Blacktown's CBD was never put out to tender, which Liberal councillors now claim was against the law.

title.children: 'A very bad deal': Blacktown CBD sale broke the law, councillors say

image.altText: An older man with long, grey beard in a dressing gown sits in an armchair

props.synopsis: TasNetworks is scrambling to restore power to more than 11,000 customers, including people like Helmut Bauerle, who has been without power since Saturday.

title.children: Six days after severe weather hit Tasmania, some residents are still unable to cook or heat their homes

image.altText: Adam Bandt press club

props.synopsis: When the Greens proposed an extra super-profits tax on the excessive part of really excessive profits last week, business and the government acted as if the sky was about to fall in. But the principle behind the idea is a good one — as Labor and the Business Council should know better than anyone.

title.children: While the super-tax proposal is being criticised, it's an idea that Labor and big business used to like

image.altText: A handsome man looks out wistfully, wearing armour.

props.synopsis: Charlie Vickers plays dark lord Sauron on Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power, but didn't even know until he'd filmed several episodes.

title.children: How a rising actor from regional Victoria landed Tolkien's most famous villain

image.altText: A nurse extracts a vaccine from a small vial into a syringe.

props.synopsis: Two new COVID-19 vaccines targeting the JN.1 variant are under review by the TGA. We asked experts about the new vaccines and what we can expect if they're approved.

title.children: New COVID vaccines could soon be available. So when's the best time to get a booster?

image.altText: Signs unfurled above the entrance of Parliament House about the War in Gaza.

props.synopsis: Four protesters who scaled the roof of Parliament House in Canberra in July have been sentenced in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Three of four protesters avoid conviction for pro-Gaza protest on the roof of Parliament House

image.altText: A large red flower with dozens of stems reaching up into a crimson circle sits surrounded by green leaves

props.synopsis: A relative of the famous NSW waratah is now under threat as the federal government says it is using the "best available science" to protect threatened species from extinction.

title.children: Waratah species under threat as danger to flora and fauna grows

image.altText: A woman next to some tents

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Greens leader's newsletter contains a profile of a Palestinian refugee family and has been deemed "anti-Semitic" and a misuse of ratepayer money by the LNP.

title.children: Brisbane councillor asked to repay $20k of ratepayer funds spent on 'anti-Semitic' newsletter

image.altText: Jay Vine waves his hands

props.synopsis: Jay Vine spent weeks in a neck brace and was left fearing for his ongoing health after a shocking crash at the Tour of the Basque Country. Just five months later, he is back in Spain, and back on top.

title.children: Five months after Jay Vine was left wondering if he would walk again, he climbs into the king of the mountain jersey

image.altText: A man with a microphone

props.synopsis: A Queensland MP is facing criticism for speaking at a gathering of conspiracy theorists who erroneously claim vaccines cause stupidity and fire ant bait is harmful to fetal brain development.

title.children: MP slammed for speaking at 'scaremongering' rally that claimed fire ant bait shrinks babies' heads

image.altText: A plain-clothed policeman leads a man in dark clothing towards a police plane on a remote airstrip.

props.synopsis: Police arrested the two men after allegedly witnessing them unloading 110kg of cocaine at a remote Cape York wharf.

title.children: Pair arrested over alleged possession of $44m worth of cocaine at remote wharf

image.altText: A beluga whale being fed fish from a boat.

props.synopsis: The death of a friendly beluga "spy whale" with a mysterious past shows the complex relationship between humans and wildlife, with conservationists split on how best to protect the animal until the end.

title.children: How a Russian 'spy whale' captured the hearts and minds of conservationists
